intro: Staurogyne argentea, commonly known as silverleaf watermilfoil, is a submerged aquatic plant native to freshwater environments in the Americas. It has finely divided, feathery leaves that are typically 10–20 cm long and arranged in whorls around the stem. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually pollinated by water currents. Its roots form dense mats that help stabilize sediments and provide habitat for aquatic organisms. Staurogyne argentea is often found in slow-moving or still waters such as ponds and lakes.
